title: High Energy Intensity Level
description: In 2021, Trinidad and Tobago had an energy intensity level of 18.72 MJ/$2017 PPP GDP, indicating a high energy consumption relative to its economic output.

title: Low GDP per Unit of Energy Use
description: In 2022, the GDP per unit of energy use was 3.04 PPP $ per kg of oil equivalent, reflecting inefficiencies in energy utilization.

title: High Energy Use per GDP
description: Trinidad and Tobago used 352.40 kg of oil equivalent per $1,000 GDP in 2022, highlighting a high energy consumption rate for economic activities.

title: Comprehensive Trade Binding Coverage
description: In 2022, Trinidad and Tobago achieved 100% binding coverage for all products, ensuring stable and predictable trade tariffs.

title: Complete Binding Coverage for Primary Products
description: The country maintained a 100% binding coverage for primary products in 2022, securing consistent trade terms for essential goods.
